alert.note: Alert for Annette Island; City and Borough of Wrangell; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Petersburg Borough; Prince of Wales Island (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 24 at 9:44AM AKST until February 25 at 9:00AM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...SNOW LASTING THROUGH SATURDAY... .Low pressure over the NE Gulf will remain in place through Friday while an associated front with embedded waves will move over the panhandle. Light snow is expected through the day, then a stronger wave along the front will cause rates to pick up in the late afternoon and evening. Some uncertainty remains regarding snow totals due to limited moisture in the central and northern inner channels. For most areas the greatest snowfall rates continue to be Friday evening through early Saturday morning while Yakutat may see snow ending earlier. ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO 9 AM AKST SATURDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 12 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Petersburg Borough, Prince of Wales Island, City and Borough of Wrangell, Ketchikan Gateway Borough and Annette Island. * WHEN...From 9 AM this morning to 9 AM AKST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the Friday evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light, dry snow will fall during the day Friday, then greater rates are expected Friday evening and Friday night. Lower amounts along western Prince of Wales Island near sea level. Some mixing with rain is possible late Friday night along the outer coast of Prince of Wales and Annette Islands. Rates begin to diminish early Saturday morning.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.

area.areaDesc: Annette Island; City and Borough of Wrangell; Ketchikan Gateway Borough; Petersburg Borough; Prince of Wales Island
